body_html:
Well, no it doesn't, or at least not the one I am looking at. As can be seen on that link:
https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/nn.html#torch.nn.Fold

I am copy-pasting the section you seem to refer, where I don't see "by summing the overlapping values":

This operation combines these local blocks into the large output tensor of shape (N,C,output_size[0],output_size[1],…). Similar to Unfold, the arguments must satisfy

Is the link above the wrong way to look for documentation on torch.nn.Fold?

body:
Well, no it doesn't, or at least not the one I am looking at. As can be seen on that link:
https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/nn.html#torch.nn.Fold

I am copy-pasting the section you seem to refer, where I don't see "by summing the overlapping values":
>  This operation combines these local blocks into the large output tensor of shape (N,C,output_size[0],output_size[1],…). Similar to Unfold, the arguments must satisfy

Is the link above the wrong way to look for documentation on `torch.nn.Fold`?
